newsitem.title: USA: Broderbund profit falls 44 percent on weak sales.
newsitem.headline: Broderbund profit falls 44 percent on weak sales.

text.p: Broderbund Software Inc. said Thursday its fiscal first quarter net income fell 44 percent amid declining revenue from its chief educational software products.
Broderbund, based in Novato, Calif., said profit for the quarter ended Nov. 30 fell to $8.9 million, or 42 cents a share, from $15.9 million, or 73 cents, in the same quarter a year ago.
Wall Street expected Broderbund to earn 43 cents a share, according to a recent analyst survey by First Call.
First-quarter revenue slipped 13 percent to $61.5 million from $71 million a year ago.
Broderbund publishes educational and entertainment programs such as "Where in the World is Carmen Sandiego?" and "Myst."
Although sales of its productivity and education products rose in the quarter, sales of its entertainment titles declined because of a lack of new products, the company said.
The company also blamed price cuts for the lower results.
"Although we are please our first-quarter results met expectations, we are not satisfied with this level of overall operations," Joe Durrett, chief executive officer, said in a release.
